tourBios.exmtStatus: Exempt - Next 25 Money Winners from 2015 Web.com Tour Finals
tourBios.curYearHigh: Finished the Web.com Tour season with 24 starts, one runner-up, two top-10s, nine top-25s and 17 cuts made. Was 29th on the combined season-long money list...Solid start to the year included seven cuts made and no finish worse than a season-opening T34 in Panama...In his third event, the Cartagena de Indias at Karibana Championship in Colombia, opened with a 67. Played the final 54 holes at 1-over par for a T4...In his seventh event, fired 67-67 and was one behind the co-leaders after 36 holes. Was still one behind eventual winner Wes Roach starting play on Sunday. Sluggish start Sunday slowed his momentum, resulting in a final-round 71 and the eventual T2. Got to seventh on the money list...Was steady through the remainder of the Regular Season, yet top finishes were in short supply. Missed just three cuts and recorded four finishes of T26 or better, with a T15 at the Digital Ally Open his top effort...Finished the Regular Season 28th in earnings. Was No. 2 through the Regular Season in Driving Distance (319.5 yards)...In the Web.com Tour Finals, had an indifferent start, posting a T52, a missed cut and a T39 in the first three events. Was 62nd on the Finals' money list with one event to go and in need of a big week at the Web.com Tour Championship to get to No. 25 or better. Put himself in position with scores of 71-65-67 the first three trips around TPC Sawgrass. Was T7 and projected at No. 23 on the Finals' money list entering the last day of the season. In need of pars on the last three holes to secure a card, was done in by a ball in the water on No. 16 and a plugged lie in a greenside bunker at No. 17, both leading to bogeys. A final-round 70 and T12 finish pushed him to 39th on the Finals' money list, $6,280 short of the 25th and final spot.
tourBios.carHigh:
2014: Rookie season on the PGA TOUR included eight made cuts in 23 starts, finishing the season No. 177 in the FedExCup standings...Played in the Asian Tour's Thailand Open in mid-December (missed the cut)...Top finish of the campaign was a T26 at the Travelers Championship. After opening with a 1-over 71, shot rounds of 65-69-68 at TPC River Highlands...Played in five Web.com Tour events, making four cuts. Defended at the Albertsons Boise Open in July, posting a T32...Finished T17, T52, T27 and missed the cut in four Web.com Tour Finals' events...Ended 65th in the priority ranking, 15 spots behind the 50th and final card issued.

2013: With limited Web.com Tour access at the beginning of the year, enjoyed an impressive campaign, which featured a win and four top-10s in 18 events. Made the cut in 14 of those 18...Earned his first professional win, taking a playoff title over Spencer Levin at the Albertsons Boise Open. Rolled in a 6-foot birdie putt on the first extra hole at Hillcrest CC. Fired weekend rounds of 63-64 to finish at 23-under 261. Trailed by four shots when he went birdie-eagle-birdie starting at No. 15, tying Levin, who had posted a 63 about 30 minutes earlier. Collected a check for $139,500, which moved him from No. 39 to No. 6 on the money list with only four events left before the inaugural Web.com Tour Finals. The victory locked up a berth on the PGA TOUR in 2013-14...Was solo fourth at the inaugural Brasil Classic in April, his first start of his rookie season on Tour. Posted weekend scores of 66-66 in the weather-delayed event to reach 16-under par, three back of winner Benjamin Alvarado...Had a hole-in-one on the par-3 12th in the second round of the Mexico Championship...Finished T9 at the United Leasing Championship...Recorded a T4 at the Cox Classic to finish the Regular Season fifth in earnings and secure his 2013-14 PGA TOUR card...A disappointing Web.com Tour Finals saw him make two of four cuts, with a T52 his best finish.

 2012: Father, Bob, caddied for him at the PGA TOUR Qualifying Tournament in Palm Springs, Calif., where he earned conditional status on the Web.com Tour after finishing T139...Made two starts on the PGA TOUR, missing the cut at both the AT&T Pebble Beach National Pro-Am and the Mayakoba Golf Classic...Made the cut in two of four starts on the Web.com Tour, with his best finish a T5 at the Miccosukee Championship in October. 2011: Made his professional debut at the Travelers Championship, with his father caddying for him (missed the cut). Made three other PGA TOUR starts, also failing to make the cut at the John Deere Classic, RBC Canadian Open and Frys.com Open. 2008: Qualified for the U.S. Open at Torrey Pines GC, where he missed the cut.
tourBios.otherCarHigh: Won five tournaments at Oklahoma State and was a four-time All American...Won the 2005 U.S. Junior Amateur...In high school, won the Oklahoma Class 6A individual title in 2006 and 2007.
tourBios.personal: Favorite golf memory was caddying in the Par 3 Contest at the Masters for his father...His father, Bob, has made more than 680 PGA TOUR starts and recorded eight wins...Follows the Oklahoma City Thunder...Twitter account is @KevinTway...Not many people know he sings in the shower...Supports the Scott Verplank Foundation...Always travels with his pillow and his cell phone is always on vibrate...Would love to trade places for a day with an astronaut.

2013: With limited Web.com Tour access at the beginning of the year, enjoyed an impressive campaign, which featured a win and four top-10s in 18 events. Made the cut in 14 of those 18...Earned his first professional win, taking a playoff title over Spencer Levin at the Albertsons Boise Open. Rolled in a 6-foot birdie putt on the first extra hole at Hillcrest CC. Fired weekend rounds of 63-64 to finish at 23-under 261. Trailed by four shots when he went birdie-eagle-birdie starting at No. 15, tying Levin, who had posted a 63 about 30 minutes earlier. Collected a check for $139,500, which moved him from No. 39 to No. 6 on the money list with only four events left before the inaugural Web.com Tour Finals. The victory locked up a berth on the PGA TOUR in 2013-14...Was solo fourth at the inaugural Brasil Classic in April, his first start of his rookie season on Tour. Posted weekend scores of 66-66 in the weather-delayed event to reach 16-under par, three back of winner Benjamin Alvarado...Had a hole-in-one on the par-3 12th in the second round of the Mexico Championship...Finished T9 at the United Leasing Championship...Recorded a T4 at the Cox Classic to finish the Regular Season fifth in earnings and secure his 2013-14 PGA TOUR card...A disappointing Web.com Tour Finals saw him make two of four cuts, with a T52 his best finish.

2012: Father, Bob, caddied for him at the PGA TOUR Qualifying Tournament in Palm Springs, Calif., where he earned conditional status on the Web.com Tour after finishing T139...Made two starts on the PGA TOUR, missing the cut at both the AT&T Pebble Beach National Pro-Am and the Mayakoba Golf Classic...Made the cut in two of four starts on the Web.com Tour, with his best finish a T5 at the Miccosukee Championship in October. 

2011: Made his professional debut at the Travelers Championship, with his father caddying for him (missed the cut). Made three other PGA TOUR starts, also failing to make the cut at the John Deere Classic, RBC Canadian Open and Frys.com Open. 

2008: Qualified for the U.S. Open at Torrey Pines GC, where he missed the cut. 

Amateur: Won five tournaments at Oklahoma State and was a four-time All American…Won the 2005 U.S. Junior Amateur…In high school, won the Oklahoma Class 6A individual title in 2006 and 2007.
tourBios.personal: Favorite golf memory was caddying in the Par 3 Contest at the Masters for his father, Bob, who has made more than 680 PGA TOUR starts and recorded eight wins…Follows the Oklahoma City Thunder…Twitter account is @KevinTway…Supports the Scott Verplank Foundation…Always travels with his pillow…His cell phone is always on vibrate…Would love to trade places for a day with an astronaut.

dyn.dynResults: His best finish on the Web.com Tour in 2016 is T5th at the El Bosque Mexico Championship presented by INNOVA.
dyn.dynStats: He ranks T71st in Scoring Average (Actual) on the Web.com Tour.
